title: I'm in class 8th can you tell me some good books for me so that I score in my upcoming exams? - Quora

response.answer_text: For class 8th, you must refer to Oswaal Books Question Banks. They provide comprehensive practice material for every chapter. They are prepared by experienced teachers who have translated their expertise into making important questions from every chapter in order to facilitate wholesome learning of every concept. Some highlights are: They are strictly as per the NCERT CurriculumA synopsis of the important points from every chapterChapterwise Introduction to enable Quick RevisionValue Based Questions & High Order Thinking Questions as specified by CBSE BoardAnswers as per the marking scheme and the prescribed word limitFlow Charts in each chapter for concept clarityHence they are very useful. All the best!

Hi. Living science and S Chand are really good for science. And for maths, if you have a lot of time, and patience, use RD Sharma. That’s the best reference book for math till class 10. If you don’t have enough time, go with RS Agarwal. It's good too, but a little less tough. But if you have really less time and lot to revise, I suggest you look into Exemplar questions and past papers, because class 8 exams would have exam questions in a similar pattern
